meanings.definition: The act of coercing or the state of being coerced.
meanings.sent1: The coercions by the bully made the students feel scared.
meanings.sent2: The government used coercions to make the citizens follow the new law.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's playful coercions to get the students to participate in class were always effective.
meanings.sent4: The coercions of nature can be seen in the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The coercions of peer pressure can sometimes lead to poor decisions.

meanings.definition: The use of force or intimidation to obtain compliance.
meanings.sent1: The coercions of the robber made the shopkeeper give him the money.
meanings.sent2: The dictator's coercions kept the people in fear and submission.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful coercions to get more treats from its owner were amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The coercions of time can make even the strongest structures crumble.
meanings.sent5: The coercions of a strict boss can sometimes lead to a toxic work environment.
